meanings.definition: A person who subjugates or conquers others.
meanings.sent1: The subjugator led his army to victory in the battle.
meanings.sent2: The ruthless subjugator enslaved entire villages.
meanings.sent3: The subjugator tried to conquer the land but got lost in the forest.
meanings.sent4: She was a subjugator of hearts, breaking them with her charm.
meanings.sent5: The subjugator's name struck fear into the hearts of all who heard it.

meanings.definition: To bring under control or subjection.
meanings.sent1: The king sought to subjugator his enemies and expand his kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The dictator used force to subjugator the population and suppress any dissent.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to subjugator the unruly ingredients into a delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to subjugator the entire city with its fierce winds.
meanings.sent5: She had to subjugator her fear in order to stand up for herself.
